01_01.english_transcription: The name of Allah, most merciful and compassionate.

01_07.english_transcription: the way of those you have divinely blessed, who have not then incurred wrath, or utterly lost the way.

01_05.english_transcription: You alone we humbly adore, and in you alone we seek help.

01_04.english_transcription: Master of the Day of Reckoning.

01_02.english_transcription: while praise is Allah's Lord of all worlds of beings.

114_01.english_transcription: In the name of Allah, most merciful and compassionate, say I take refuge in the Lord of men.

114_04.english_transcription: from the evil of the cunning insinuator of ill thoughts, who ever draws back from being guessed.

114_05.english_transcription: who sews and sews ill thoughts in the breast of men.

114_06.english_transcription: Be he a vile djinn or men.

113_05.english_transcription: and from the evil of envier when gripped by envy.

113_04.english_transcription: and from the evil of wicked souls who blow spittle mist on sorcerous nuts.

113_03.english_transcription: and from the evil of outward blackest night when it fills everything.

113_02.english_transcription: from the evil of all he has created.

113_01.english_transcription: In the name of Allah, most merciful and compassionate, say I take refuge in the Lord of Daybreak.

112.english_transcription: and no one even compares with him.

109_04.english_transcription: nor ever shall I be a worshipper of what you have worshipped.

109_03.english_transcription: nor ever shall you be worshipers of what I worship.

109_02.english_transcription: Never shall I worship what you worship.

109_01.english_transcription: In the name of Allah most merciful and compassionate, say, O utter unbelievers,

109_06.english_transcription: Your religion is but yours, and mine is but mine.

97_01.english_transcription: In the name of Allah, most merciful and compassionate, verily we commence sending it down on the night of destiny.

97_05.english_transcription: Absolute peace and safety it is to the rise of the dawn.

97_02.english_transcription: and what may teach you what is the night of destiny.

97_03.english_transcription: The night of destiny is better than a thousand months.

97_04.english_transcription: Therein the angels and the supreme angelic spirit of life-giving revelation descend in throng after throng by leave of their Lord to set every matter that shall happen that year.

99_01.english_transcription: in the name of a law most merciful and compassionate when the whole earth is set a quake as balefully as it may be shaken

99_02.english_transcription: and the earth casts up its mighty burdens.

99_03.english_transcription: and man says, whatever can be the matter with it.

99_04.english_transcription: On that day shall I recount its news.

99_06.english_transcription: That day shall mankind return, apart, alone, unfriended, to be shown their works.

99_05.english_transcription: that your Lord has given it cue to.

99_08.english_transcription: and whoever works the way to a speck of dust of evil shall see it.

99_07.english_transcription: So whoever works the weight of a speck of dust, of good, shall see it.

105_01.english_transcription: In the name of Allah, most merciful and compassionate, have you not seen how your Lord did with those of the mighty war elephant?

105_02.english_transcription: Did he not send their guile completely astray?

105_03.english_transcription: and loose against them flock after flock of unheard of eerie birds.

105_04.english_transcription: raining down on them hails of fatally piercing stones of fired clay.

105_05.english_transcription: So he made them like stubble grazed clean away.
